articles.title: Congratulations to Angolan President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Angolan President 
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a congratulatory message to Jose Eduardo Dos Santos upon his re-assumption as president of Angola.
					 Kim in the message expressed belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Angola with the long historic tradition would grow stronger as the days go by, heartily wishing the Angolan president fresh and greater success in his responsible work for the national unity and the country's prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Brazil
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Brazil 
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on Sept. 7 sent a message of greeting to President of Brazil Dilma Vana Rousseff to celebrate the 190th anniversary of Brazil's independence.
					 Kim in the message expressed conviction that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Brazil favorably developing in recent years would grow stronger in several fields.
					
					 Kim sincerely wished the Brazilian president and the people greater success in their work for the country's development and prosperity.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop Meets Chinese Delegation
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets Chinese Delegation
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with a Chinese youth friendship delegation headed by Wang Hongyan, member of the Secretariat of the Central Committee of the Communist Youth League of China, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday when it paid a courtesy call on him.
					 China and the DPRK are the friendly neighbors linked by the same mountain and rivers, the head of the delegation said, adding the friendly relations between the two countries with long history are common wealth.
					
					 He hoped the Korean youth would register great successes in building a thriving socialist nation under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Group's Mockery of DPRK over Issue of Relief Aid Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Group's Mockery of DPRK over Issue of Relief Aid Slammed 
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Central Committee of the DPRK Red Cross Society gave the following answer to the question put by KCNA on Sept. 12 as regards the south Korean puppet regime's mockery of the DPRK over the issue of flood relief aid to it:
					 The south Korean Red Cross on Sept. 3 sent a notice proposing to have a Red Cross contact between the north and the south, saying the south would "render sincere aid without any conditions" allegedly to help the north recover from the flood damage.
					
					 An extremely tense situation is prevailing in Korea due to the south Korean puppet regime's reckless moves for a war, but we sent a notice to the south Korean Red Cross asking it to let us know about items and quantity of the aid materials, clarifying its stance to take into consideration the proposal if the latter provides goods substantially helpful to bringing the living of the inhabitants in the afflicted areas to normal and recovering from the damage in the spirit of humanitarianism. 
					
					 We, at the same time, made it clear that if the south Korean authorities seek to make a mockery of us over the issue of flood relief aid as they did in the past, this kind of offer is worse than sending nothing.
					
					 However, the south Korean Red Cross in its notice on Sept. 11 seriously insulted us again by offering to send a negligible quantity of goods to us.
					
					 The puppet group did not have even an iota of intention to sincerely help us recover from the damage from the very outset.
					
					 When different countries of the world and international bodies were rendering sincere help to us, the south Korean puppet regime chilled the atmosphere of aid to us, claiming that "the north is exaggerating its flood damage."
					
					 Worse still, when non-governmental organizations of south Korea intended to send relief goods to us, the south Korean regime disallowed the action, talking about "papers confirming the distribution of them" and "field confirmation."
					
					 It persistently insisted on disallowing the offer of rice, cement and equipment for rehabilitation, in particular, claiming that those things" can be diverted to other purposes."
					
					 This goes to clearly prove that the south Korean puppet group's proposal to offer aid is nothing but a gesture to gain gratitude and save its face under the public pressure.
					
					 There have been not a few cases of humanitarian cooperation between the north and the south of Korea so far but never has there been such mean group as the Lee Myung Bak group which made a mockery of the noble spirit of humanitarianism of Red Cross.
					
					 We were really shocked to see the Red Cross of south Korea joining the group of traitors in using the natural disaster that hit compatriots for its sinister aim as its marionette.
					
					 The above-said action brought to light again the evil mind and ulterior motive of the puppet group. 
					
					 From the outset we did not expect anything from the puppet authorities as regards the flood damage but their behavior increased our feelings of disillusion.
					
					 The Lee group is doomed to meet the most miserable end, cursed by all Koreans, as it is bereft of elementary ethics and morality and even an iota of reason for being crazy for confrontation with compatriots.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from King of Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from King of Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a congratulatory message from AbdullahⅡ, king of the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan, on September 6.
					 The message said:
					
					 I, the people and the government of the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan extend sincerest greetings and congratulations to Your Excellency and the people of the DPRK on the occasion of the founding day of the DPRK.
					
					 Availing myself of this opportunity, I would like to wish Your Excellency good health and happiness and the friendly people of your country steady progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Egyptian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Egyptian President
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from President of Egypt Muhammad Morsi on Tuesday.
					 The president said in the message he was very pleased to extend heartfelt congratulations to Kim Jong Un on the founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 The president wished Kim Jong Un good health and the people of the friendly country steady progress and prosperity.
					
					 He sent the highest regards to Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Seychelles
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Seychelles
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from James Alix Michel, president of Seychelles, on Monday.
					 Availing himself of the opportunity of celebrating the 64th anniversary of the DPRK, the president in his message extended warmest and sincerest congratulations to Kim Jong Un, the government of the DPRK and its people on behalf of the government of Seychelles and its people.
					
					 He earnestly hoped that the excellent friendly and cooperative ties between Seychelles and the DPRK with long history would grow stronger in the future.
					
					 Sending his best regards to Kim Jong Un, the president wished the people of the DPRK steady prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Yemeni President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Yemeni President
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, received a message of greeting from Yemeni President Abd Rabbuh Mansur Al Hadi on Sept. 9.
					 The president in the message said that he was pleased to extend the warmest congratulations and hearty salute to Kim Jong Un on the occasion of the anniversary of the friendly DPRK, wishing him good health and happiness and the friendly Korean people steady wellbeing and development.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Emir of Qatar
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Emir of Qatar
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, received a message of greeting from Sheikh Hamad Bin Khalifa Al-Thani, emir of Qatar, on Sept. 9. 
					 He in the message said that he was pleased to extend sincere congratulations to Kim Jong Un and, through him, to the Korean people on behalf of the people of Qatar and on his own behalf on the occasion of the anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 He most sincerely wished Kim Jong Un happiness and the Korean people steady progress. 
					
					 He sent highest regards to Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Sultan of Oman
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Sultan of Oman
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Committee of the DPRK, received a congratulatory message from Qaboos Bin Said, sultan of Sultanate of Oman, on September 8.
					 The message said:
					
					 We are pleased to extend sincere congratulations to Your Excellency on the occasion of the anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 Availing ourselves of this opportunity, we would like to wish Your Excellency good health and happiness and the friendly people of the DPRK steady progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Nigerian Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Nigerian Ambassador
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Nigerian Ambassador to the DPRK Nwofe Alexander at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.
					 After receiving the credentials, Kim had a talk with the ambassador.

articles.title: Nuclear Weapons Should Be Completely Removed: DPRK Official
articles.content:
Nuclear Weapons Should Be Completely Removed: DPRK Official
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- The head of the delegation of the Institute for Disarmament and Peace of the DPRK Foreign Ministry on Sept. 7 called for ensuring the vitality of the comprehensive test ban treaty at the Moscow International Conference on Nuclear Disarmament and Non-proliferation.
					 "Only when CTBT is enforced under the pre-condition that the nuclear weapons would be completely removed on a worldwide scale can all states be granted practically equal and just obligations and rights," he said, adding:
					
					 In that sense, the more pressing issue than enforcing CTBT is to establish the international legal framework on unconditional ban on the use and complete removal of existing nuclear weapons worldwide and work out impartial and proportionate measures for nuclear disarmament and removal based on mutual trust.
					
					 In order to make CTBT effective in the reality, its pre-conditions should be ready and for that, the main nuclear powers should fulfill their responsibility and duty in the efforts to thoroughly remove the source of the nuclear war in the world.
					
					 Especially it is important for the U.S., a nuclear superpower of the world, to stop all acts of military buildup that destroy the world stability such as modernizing and conventionalizing nuclear weapons as well as developing new ultra-modern weapons in substitute for nuclear weapons.
					
					 Unless the U.S. puts an end to these maneuvers, we would never see the folding up of arms race among the great powers aimed at defending their own security and strategic interests and this would produce grave consequences to the world peace and stability.
					
					 As been repeatedly clarified, the DPRK would discharge its responsibility and duty as a responsible nuclear state for the nuclear non-proliferation in the future.

articles.title: Chinese Delegation Pays Floral Tribute to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Chinese Delegation Pays Floral Tribute to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il 
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) --The members of a youth friendship delegation of China Thursday laid a floral basket before the equestrian statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il at the Mansudae Art Studio before paying tribute to them.

articles.title: Floral Basket to Kim Jong Un from Japanese Delegation
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Un from Japanese Delegation
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- A floral basket was presented to the dear respected Kim Jong Un by the visiting delegation of the Japanese Society for Consultation on Korean Affairs.
					 The floral basket was conveyed to an official concerned by head of the delegation Kazuyoshi Hishiki, honorary professor at Hiroshima Shudo University of Japan, on Thursday.

articles.title: DPRK Finance Delegation Leaves for Russia
articles.content:
DPRK Finance Delegation Leaves for Russia
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- A finance delegation of the DPRK headed by Ki Kwang Ho, vice-minister of Finance, left here for Russia on Thursday.

articles.title: Reception Given by Cuban Ambassador on DPRK's Birthday
articles.content:
Reception Given by Cuban Ambassador on DPRK's Birthday
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Cuban Ambassador to the DPRK German Hermin Ferras Alvarez on Thursday hosted a reception at his embassy to celebrate the 64th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 Present there on invitation were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Kim Yong Il, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and officials concerned.
					
					 The ambassador said in his speech the development of the friendly relations between the DPRK and Cuba would be unthinkable without the efforts made by Fidel Castro Ruz and Raul Castro Ruz and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Cuba will boost the friendly relations between the two parties and peoples as intended by the top leaders, the ambassador added.
					
					 On behalf of the party, government and people of Cuba, the ambassador wished the dear respected Kim Jong Un success in his responsible work for leading the Korean people.
					
					 Yang Hyong Sop said Cuban comrades significantly celebrated the anniversary of the founding of the DPRK every year, adding it is a clear indication of their fraternal feelings and solidarity and this greatly encourages the Korean people in their drive for building a thriving nation.
					
					 He said he was pleased that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Cuba are steadily growing under the deep care of the top leaders of the two countries.
					
					 Yang hoped that the fraternal Cuban people would achieve greater successes in the struggle to foil the U.S. blockade against their country, defend the gains of socialism and implement the decisions of the 6th party congress, rallied close around Fidel Castro Ruz and Raul Castro Ruz.

articles.title: DPRK, Chinese Young People Hold Friendly Meeting
articles.content:
DPRK, Chinese Young People Hold Friendly Meeting
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Young people of the DPRK and China held a joint friendly meeting at the Central Youth Hall Thursday. 
					 Present there were officials of the C. C., the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League including Vice-Chairman Kil Chol Hyok, officials of the youth league here, youth and students in the city of Pyongyang, members of the youth friendship delegation of China led by Wang Hongyan, member of the Secretariat of the Central Committee of the Communist Youth League of China, and staff members of the Chinese embassy here.
					
					 Speeches were made at the meeting.
					
					 Speakers said that the traditional bilateral friendly ties provided by leaders of the elder generation of the two countries are growing stronger generation after generation and century after century.
					
					 The young people of the two countries are entrusted with a heavy yet honorable task for invariably inheriting and developing the DPRK-China friendship, their common wealth, the speakers said, adding the future of the friendship depends on the young people, the master of the future.
					
					 They stressed the need to further deepen friendly feelings between the peoples and young peoples of the two countries.
					
					 They expressed belief that the meeting will offer an important occasion for deepening the mutual understanding and friendship and developing the friendly relations between youth bodies.
					
					 An art performance was given by the art squad of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League and young artistes of China.
					
					 The performers vividly portrayed the young people of the DPRK who perform heroic feats while going through thick and thin in hearty response to the call of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 They represented well the firm will of the young Chinese people to make a positive contribution to building a socialist society with Chinese characteristics true to the leadership of the Communist Party of China.
					
					 There was a dancing party of young people of the two countries.

articles.title: China's Pavilion Enjoys Popularity in Pyongyang Book Fair
articles.content:
China's Pavilion Enjoys Popularity in Pyongyang Book Fair
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- The 8th Pyongyang International Science and Technology Book Fair took place at the Grand People's Study House here on Sept. 10-12.
					 Conspicuous in the fair was the pavilion of the State Press and Publication Administration of China.
					
					 Jon Yong Hui, an employee at the Grand People's Study House, told KCNA:
					
					 "The State Press and Publication Administration of China exhibited many volumes of books in the fair, enjoying popularity.
					
					 Especially, the sci-tech books drew great interest from local scientists and students."
					
					 Jong Kwang Ryol, a student at Kim Chaek University of Technology, said:
					
					 "At the exhibition I could get a better understanding of what I wanted to know."
					
					 Kim Pong Hun, a researcher at the State Academy of Sciences, said:
					
					 "The books exhibited gave me a glimpse of the latest sci-tech achievements made worldwide. They are helpful to obtaining necessary knowledge."
					
					 The administration took part in the fair several times in the past and exhibited more than 4 000 volumes of books this time.
					
					 On Wednesday, it donated the exhibited books to the DPRK on behalf of the press organs in China.

articles.title: Laotian Party Official Calls for Development of DPRK-Laos Friendship
articles.content:
Laotian Party Official Calls for Development of DPRK-Laos Friendship
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Sisouk Philavong, vice-chairman of the Commission for Propaganda and Training Affairs of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party, said he was pleased to visit the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 During his stay in the DPRK he witnessed the Korean people achieving eye-opening developments, he added.
					
					 The visit to the Museum of Arms and Equipment of the Korean People's Army helped get the knowledge of the strong military capabilities of Songun Korea, he said, adding:
					
					 Such miraculous events have been possible in the DPRK thanks to the patriotic devotion by the great leaders.
					
					 The Korean people are glorifying generation after generation the exploits President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il performed by laying an eternal foundation for the prosperity of the country and nation.
					
					 Laos and the DPRK have long-standing friendly relations.
					
					 President Kaysone Phomvihane and President Kim Il Sung provided those friendly relations.
					
					 The meeting between Comrades Choummaly Sayasone and Kim Jong Il last September marked an important occasion for spurring the development of friendly relations between the two countries.
					
					 He said he will positively contribute to the development of the friendly relations between the two parties and countries.
					
					 He expressed conviction that the Korean people would preserve and add glory to the undying feats of the peerlessly great men under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Relief Aid Directed to Komdok Area to Help Recover from Flood Damage
articles.content:
Relief Aid Directed to Komdok Area to Help Recover from Flood Damage 
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Relief aid has been concentrated on the Komdok area from across the country to help recover from flood damage.
					 The Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, the Secretariat of the Cabinet, the Ministry of Coal Industry, the Ministry of Mining Industry, the Ministry of Land and Marine Transport and other ministries and national institutions have preferentially sent materials urgently needed for the living including foodstuff, household articles and clothes to the flood-stricken inhabitants.
					
					 Officials and other people in South Hamgyong Province sent edible oil, non-staple foods and daily necessities to the afflicted areas.
					
					 Those in Pyongyang, North Hamgyong, Kangwon, Jagang provinces and Rason City sent sanitary articles, underwear, notebooks, etc.
					
					 Service personnel of the Korean People's Army and their families and employees who have been engaged in the rehabilitation campaign called at inhabitants carrying with them kitchen utensils and basic foodstuff for 400 families.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Sunchon Cement Complex, Chollima Steel Complex, Pyongyang 326 Electric Wire Factory and other industrial establishments have directed primary efforts into ensuring the provision of materials needed for rehabilitation projects.

articles.title: Medical Herb Cultivation Brisk in DPRK
articles.content:
Medical Herb Cultivation Brisk in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Medical herbs are planted and gathered in September-October months in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 In this period, cultivated and wild medical plants are gathered throughout the country.
					
					 Short courses for collection and storage of herbs are given at relevant institutes and units.
					
					 The gatherers observe the principle of picking a root of plant and planting ten roots of plant.
					
					 Deep attention is paid to storing the harvested plants.
					
					 Jong Sun Ok, a deputy director of the Koryo Medicine Production Bureau of the Ministry of Public Health, told KCNA:
					
					 "We are making efforts to timely send medical herbs and fruits to Koryo medicine factories to ensure smooth production of traditional medicines."
					
					 North Hwanghae, Jagang and South Hamgyong provinces take the lead in cultivating medical plants.
					
					 Such cultivation is also carried on by many factories, institutes, co-op farms and rural communities across the country in keeping with their specific conditions.

articles.title: National Tournament of Football Classes Held in DPRK
articles.content:
National Tournament of Football Classes Held in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- The second national tournament of football classes at secondary schools took place here some days ago.
					 The tournament brought together school boys and girls selected from provinces and cities of the country.
					
					 It showcased more tactical and active matches than the previous one.
					
					 The matches were held, divided into the first and second-grade, the third and fourth-grade and the fifth and sixth-grade events.
					
					 The fifth and sixth-grade matches drew interest in the tournament.
					
					 Boys and girls from Pyongyang and Nampho cities, South Phyongan and North Hwanghae provinces proved successful in the tournament.

articles.title: Korean Revolution Sure to Triumph Thanks to Songun Politics: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Korean Revolution Sure to Triumph Thanks to Songun Politics: Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- The DPRK has followed the road chosen by itself, remaining unfazed in face of the counter-revolutionary offensive of the imperialist allied forces as it has advanced, tightly holding arms. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday says in a bylined article.
					
					 Big or small wars in the 20th century taught a serious lesson that any country or nation which neglected army building or had weak military capability could not beat back the imperialists' aggression and armed intervention but allowed themselves to fall into the position of a stateless nation, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The imperialist forces in the grip of a serious crisis politically and economically seek to find a way out of the abyss of ruin in igniting a new war.
					
					 There is no knowing where and when a new war of aggression will be launched by the imperialists to expand the sphere of their domination.
					
					 The philosophical principle that one should more tightly hold arms of revolution remains unchanged so long as there are imperialists on the globe.
					
					 If a country fails to bolster up its capability for self-defense, it cannot stand up firm against the imperialists.
					
					 History goes to prove that the idea of attaching importance to the army should not be considered as a temporary way and as a tactical issue as long as there is imperialism.
					
					 A country is sure to triumph if it tightly holds arms. This is clearly proved by the practical experience of the DPRK.
					
					  In face of the might of Songun politics, neither siege nor nuclear blackmail nor missile racket of the imperialists against the DPRK would prove workable.
					
					 Steadfast are the stand and determination of the Korean people to reinforce the deterrent for self-defense, firmly holding the arms of Songun, no matter how the situation may change and no matter how many trials they may face.

articles.title: Japan's Moves to Tamper with Its History Lead to Its Self-destruction: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Japan's Moves to Tamper with Its History Lead to Its Self-destruction: Rodong Sinmun 
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Japanese Prime Minister Noda and other political heavyweights persistently insist that there is no evidence that Japanese imperialists forced women into sexual slavery in the past. The chairman of the National Public Safety Commission of Japan cried out for retracting the 1993 "Kono statement" in which he made an apology for the issue of sexual slavery. 
					 In the meantime, the Japanese government is set to bring the issue of Tok Islets to the International Court of Justice.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday says in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is a product of the crafty moves of the Japanese reactionaries to evade the responsibility for the past crimes and dodge the obligation to pay reparation for them at any cost.
					
					 The issue of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army was recognized by the international community as a monstrous crime against humanity and it is the unanimous view of the international community that the Japanese government should honestly admit it, apologize for it and take steps for paying reparation for it.
					
					 It was proved by history that 200 000 Korean women were forcibly taken away, kidnapped and lured before being forced to provide sex to the Japanese imperialist aggressors in the past.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are mulling bringing the issue of Tok Islets, part of the inviolable territory of Korea, to the International Court of Justice, insisting that they belong to Japan. This is a prelude to their operations to stage a comeback to Korea.
					
					 Those who tamper with history have no future.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are fated to die before their times if they work hard to prolong their existence by misinterpreting the past crimes and trying to dodge their settlement.
					
					 Japan would be well advised to be sincere and honest and opt for redressing its past crimes.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Criticized for Working Out War Scenario against DPRK
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Criticized for Working Out War Scenario against DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- The "basic plan for national defense policy" recently announced by the south Korean "government" authorities is a DPRK-targeted war scenario that calls for reorganizing the military's structure in an offensive way and equipping it with latest war weaponry, thus laying a groundwork for doing harm to fellow countrymen.
					 Minju Joson Thursday says this in a bylined commentary.
					
					 The commentary notes the "basic plan for national defense policy" envisaged creation of a mountain brigade in the ground force, expansion of the cyber command twice the present size, organization of a submarine headquarters in the navy, reorganization of a brigade for special warfare into a flotilla, establishment of a brigade-level unit and an aerial corps in the navy and a new unit for monitoring and controlling satellites and an air intelligence corps in the air force.
					
					 On top of it, the plan implied development and deployment of ground-to-ground missiles aimed at striking the nuclear facilities, missile bases, etc., in the DPRK in the contingency, introduction of long-range air-to-ground missiles, development of cyber weapons, reinforcement of reserve units for special warfare and transfer of operation command to the chiefs of the general staff of all services, says the commentary, adding:
					
					 Lurking behind the south Korean regime's announcement of the war scenario under the signboard of "defense" is an intention to intensify its confrontation with fellow countrymen in a more undisguised and planned way.
					
					 The regime is going to trigger an extreme animosity against fellow countrymen by systematically stepping up the military confrontation while rounding off the groundwork for a war in reliance on the U.S. in a bid to provoke a war against the DPRK.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will not remain an onlooker to the south Korean group of traitors' provocations for a war at the instigation of the U.S.
					
					 To respond to provocations with a prompt counter-strike and to a war with a just great war for reunifying the country--this is the answer of the DPRK.
					
					 Approaching is the day when the group of traitors will be burned to death in flame it kindled.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime to Stage Anti-DPRK Farce
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime to Stage Anti-DPRK Farce 
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet warmongers move to stage a farce for confrontation with the DPRK from Sept. 13 to 15 to praise the Inchon landing operation conducted by the U.S. imperialists in the period of the Korean War, according to south Korean Yonhap News.
					 They announced that forces of army, navy, air force and Marine Corps of south Korea and large troopship Tokdo, battleships, air force tactical airplanes, copters and armored cars and other military hardware will be mobilized in the waters off Wolmi Island on Sept. 15 to show the large-scale Inchon landing operation.
					
					 The south Korean puppet regime is mulling not only displaying weapons system and a landing ship of the then south Korean puppet navy and Marine Corps but showing such farces as seizing a lighthouse in the eyes of civilians.
					
					 In recent days, five islands including Paekryong, Taechong and Yonphyong islands and the waters off those islands turned into the biggest hotspot where a war may break out any moment due to the south Korean puppet warmongers' reckless moves for military provocations.
					
					 The south Korean group of traitors is seeking to ignite a war at any cost by staging such a farce again in the West Sea of Korea where the situation reminding one of an eve of a war is prevailing.

articles.title: S. Korean Police Searches House of Leading Official of Pomminryon
articles.content:
S. Korean Police Searches House of Leading Official of Pomminryon
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- The security investigation group of the Taegu district police agency in south Korea Wednesday searched the house of the chairman of the Taegu and North Kyongsang Provincial Federation of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon), on charge of violation of the "Security Law."
					 Members of the group stormed into the house and scoured its inside and outside. They copied the data in his computer and took away data and books related to the activities of the South Headquarters of Pomminryon and the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification.

articles.title: S. Korean Marine Corps Stages Firing Drill near Yonphyong Island
articles.content:
S. Korean Marine Corps Stages Firing Drill near Yonphyong Island
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- The south Korean marine corps staged a firing drill near Yonphyong Island on Sept. 12, according to Korean Broadcasting System of south Korea.
					 Mortars, machine guns, etc. were involved in that madcap drill.
					
					 Despite the DPRK's warning the south Korean warmongers are perpetrating reckless military provocations one after another in five islands in the West Sea of Korea and waters around them.
					
					 They should clearly bear in mind that only a miserable end and death await the provocateurs who go reckless like a puppy knowing no fear of a tiger.

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Marked by Koreans' Paper in Uzbekistan
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday Marked by Koreans' Paper in Uzbekistan
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Thongil, the newspaper of Koreans published in Uzbekistan, devoted a special write-up to the 64th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The newspaper carried an article entitled "Sep. 9, the founding day of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea."
					
					 The article said that the august name and the exploits of President Kim Il Sung who founded the DPRK and led the Korean revolution of various stages to victory are shinning with this day.
					
					 The DPRK eradicated the leftovers of the colonial rule of the Japanese imperialists in a short period after its foundation was proclaimed, achieved great successes in building a new society and won a victory in the Fatherland Liberation War, the article noted, and went on:
					
					 The DPRK is now working steady miracles in all fabrics of society and adhering to the line of the Songun revolution.

articles.title: Birthday of DPRK Marked by Koreans in Russia
articles.content:
Birthday of DPRK Marked by Koreans in Russia
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Koreans in the Far Eastern region of Russia held events to commemorate the 64th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The vice-chairman of the Central Association of Korean Nationals in Russia, chairman of the Autonomous Society for National Culture of Korean Nationals in Nakhodka, chairman of the Autonomous Society for Korean National Culture in Partizansk City and other compatriots laid a floral basket and bouquets before the full-length painting of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il standing together on Mt. Paektu at the DPRK consulate general in Nakhodka before paying tribute to them on Sept. 8.
					
					 There took place meetings of Koreans in Kholmsk City in Sakhalin Region and Yelizovo in Kamchatka Territory on Sept. 9.
					
					 Present there were Jang Sun Jong, chairperson of the Central Association of Korean Nationals in Russia, Ri Chae Son, chairperson of the Association of Korean Nationals in Kamchatka Territory, Sin Hyon No, chairperson of the United Confederation of Koreans in Kamchatka Territory, and Koreans in Sakhalin Region and Kamchatka Territory.
					
					 The participants laid floral baskets and bouquets before portraits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il before paying tribute to them.
					
					 Congratulatory letters to the dear respected Kim Jong Un were adopted at the meetings.
					
					 Koreans in Kamchatka Territory held round-table-talks at which they praised the immortal exploits performed by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and watched a video on "'With the Century', reminiscences of the great leader Comrade Kim Il Sung".

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Carried by Romanian Paper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Carried by Romanian Paper
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- The gist of leader Kim Jong Il's work "The Historical Lesson in Building Socialism and the General Line of Our Party" was carried by the 200th issue of the Romanian paper Romania Muncitoare on September 6.
					 The work, published on January 3, 1992, clarifies that a historic lesson drawn from socialist construction is that it is necessary to steadily strengthen the driving force for revolution with faith in socialism and a correct guiding idea, adhere to the principle of socialism and strengthen the comradely unity and cooperation based on independence.
					
					 The work clarifies the idea that it is the general line of the Workers' Party of Korea for building socialism to strengthen the people's government and increase its function and role and thoroughly carry out the three revolutions -- ideological, technical and cultural. The work also explains the validity of the idea.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Works Introduced Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Works Introduced Abroad
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- A detailed gist of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Effect Kim Jong Il's Patriotism and Step Up the Building of a Prosperous Country" was carried by the Malaysian paper Guang Ming Daily on Sept. 8.
					 The work, published on July 26, 2012, clarifies the essence of     Kim Jong Il's patriotism and his whole life characterized by his noble love for the country and people.
					
					 It clarifies important issues arising in embodying Kim Jong Il's patriotism.
					
					 The full text or gist of his work "Only Victory and Glory Are in Store for Us Advancing under the Uplifted Immortal Banners Bearing Portraits of Smiling Great Comrades Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il" were posted by the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea and the International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions on their Internet homepages on Aug. 28.
					
					 The work, published on Aug. 25, 2012, deals with the Songun feats performed by Generalissimo Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It calls for vigorously struggling for the final victory of the revolutionary cause of Juche and Songun started and led to victory by Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Feats of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il Praised by Foreign Figures
articles.content:
Feats of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il Praised by Foreign Figures
						
Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Meetings were held in Bangladesh, Thailand, Norway, Germany and Peru on Sept. 5 and 6 in celebration of the 64th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 At the meetings personages of those countries praised the undying feats performed by the peerlessly great men of the DPRK.
					
					 The president of the Bangladesh People's League said President Kim Il Sung was the founder of socialist Korea who devoted his all to the reunification and independence of Korea and the freedom and happiness of the people.
					
					 The President's Juche-based idea of nation-building and exploits had been successfully inherited by leader Kim Jong Il, he said, and went on:
					
					 The Korean people will surely accomplish the cause of national reunification and the building of a rich and powerful nation under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The chairman of the Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea of Thailand said:
					
					 Kim Il Sung victoriously led the arduous great war against the Imperial Japanese Army, thus liberating Korea and founding the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					
					 Kim Jong Il developed in depth the Juche idea founded by the President and protected the sovereignty of the Korean nation by pursuing the Songun politics, thereby demonstrating the national power before the whole world.
					
					 As the dear respected Kim Jong Un, the creditable successor to the idea and cause of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, is steering the drive to build a thriving nation, the Koreans will always emerge victorious. 
					
					 The chairman of the Ostfold County Committee of the Communist Party of Norway praised the peerlessly great men for their immortal exploits for founding and developing the DPRK, adding:
					
					 The Korean people are making signal achievements in building a thriving socialist nation under the leadership of Kim Jong Un true to the behests of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 We will extend full support and solidarity to them in their just cause.

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Marked in Different Countries
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday Marked in Different Countries
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Korean film shows took place in South Africa, Nigeria, Uganda, Guinea, Mongolia, Indonesia and Singapore on the 64th anniversary of the DPRK from Aug. 29 to Sept. 6.
					 Korean films shown included "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation".
					
					 A secretary of the Mfumalanga Provincial Committee of the South African Communist Party said the 64-year-long history of the DPRK is the one of the wise leadership of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and a true history in which they made efforts to meet the interests of the people, placing them above anything else.
					
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un, successor to the cause of the preceding leaders, is glorifying Kim Il Sung's nation and Kim Jong Il's Korea, he added.
					
					 The chairman of the Nigerian Group for Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism noted Kim Jong Il formulated Songun politics as a main political mode under socialism and pursued Songun politics in all fields, defending socialism in Korea despite the worst adversity in the closing years of the last century.
					
					 The chairman of the Kampala City Committee of the Uganda National Resistance Movement said the Korean people are the people to be envied by the world as they are under the outstanding leader.
					
					 The manager of a Singaporean trading company expressed the conviction that the Korean people would surely realize the desire of Kim Jong Il for building a thriving nation, true to the leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Celebrated Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday Celebrated Abroad
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Personages of Nigeria, Sweden and Italy paid visits to the DPRK embassies in their countries on the 64th anniversary of the DPRK between Sept. 6 and 8.
					 They included Ibrahim Mantu, former deputy president of the Nigerian Senate who is a member of the Credit Committee of the People's Democratic Party of Nigeria and chairman of the Nigeria-Korea Friendship Association, and members of the association, Igwanagu Nicholas, chairman of the Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, Aba Sadik Abubakr, chairman of the Nigerian Group for the Study of the Juche Philosophy, and others of Juche idea study organizations, Chairman Anders Karlsson and International Secretary Eric Andersson of the Communist Party in Sweden and Mauro Baeli, president of the  Group of Italy.
					
					 They laid bouquets before large pictures of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il standing together and paid tribute to them.
					
					 Ibrahim Mantu said the foundation of the DPRK marked a great political event that instilled hope and courage into the African people in their struggle for national liberation in colonies.
					
					 Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il were great statesmen who built the DPRK into a socialist power with a strong sense of independence and invincible military power and imbued the oppressed people in the world with the conviction of victory, he said, and went on:.
					
					 Their exploits will shine forever with the history of the DPRK.
					
					 I wish supreme leader Marshal Kim Jong Un good health and success in his work to carry forward the cause of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Events Held to Mark DPRK Anniversary
articles.content:
Events Held to Mark DPRK Anniversary
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Diverse events took place in different countries to celebrate the 64th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 Photo and book exhibitions, film shows and round-table talks were held in Malaysia, Uganda and Iran and an event of DPRK's cultural day took place in Vladivostok of Russia between Sept. 4 and 6.
					
					 On display in the venues of the events were photos showing the undying feats performed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in founding and developing the DPRK.
					
					 Also displayed there were photos and books dealing with the proud path covered by the DPRK under the leadership of the peerlessly great men.
					
					 Korean films such as "Pyongyang at Night" were shown at the film show.
					
					 Figures and people from all walks of life in the relevant countries were present there.

articles.title: Bulletins Issued in Peru and Cambodia to Mark DPRK's Anniversary
articles.content:
Bulletins Issued in Peru and Cambodia to Mark DPRK's Anniversary 
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Bulletins were published in Peru and Cambodia on Sept. 6 on the occasion of the 64th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The Peruvian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism－Kimjongilism issued a bulletin illustrated with photos of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 It said:
					
					 We pay our sincere respects to Kim Il Sung who founded the DPRK,  illustrious commander of Songun Kim Jong Il who glorified the DPRK as a politico-ideological power and military power of Juche and Marshal Kim Jong Un who is carrying forward the revolutionary cause of Juche while demonstrating the spirit of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 Now sweeping the world is the hot wind of lauding Kim Jong Un, successor to Juche and Songun.
					
					 We send support and solidarity to the just cause of the DPRK people.
					
					 AKP of Cambodia said as follows in bulletin:
					
					 Supreme leader Kim Jong Un first appeared in the political arena as vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea at the WPK conference in September 2010 to instantly become a famous man in the world.
					
					 The speech made by him at the military parade held in celebration of the 100th birth anniversary of the President made a big splash in the world media.
					
					 Describing the speech as the political programme of the new leadership of the DPRK and the declaration of its solemn start, the media stressed that the future of the DPRK led by the young leader is promising.

articles.title: Functions Held to Mark DPRK Anniversary
articles.content:
Functions Held to Mark DPRK Anniversary
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- There took place in DPRK missions in different countries between Sept. 3 and 7 such functions as reception, remembrance meeting, book and photo exhibition and film show on the occasion of the 64th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 They included those in Beijing, Shenyang, Hong Kong of China, Khabarovsk of Russia, Vietnam, Mongolia. Laos, Cambodia, Indonesia, Myanmar, Bangladesh, Egypt, Nigeria, France and Italy, the DPRK permanent mission at the UN and the DPRK permanent missions at the UN Office and international bodies in Geneva.
					
					The participants in the film shows watched DPRK films.
					
					 Present at the functions on invitation were figures of the governments, political parties, parliaments, organizations, institutions, groups for the study of the Juche idea and the organizations for friendship and solidarity with the DPRK people of relevant countries and those of international and regional bodies and NGOs and foreign diplomats.
					
					 The vice-chairman of the Liaoning Provincial People's Political Consultative Conference of China said that since it was founded the DPRK has achieved brilliant successes in socialist construction under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The deputy envoy of the Presidential Envoy Office to the Far Eastern Region of the Russian Federation noted that Kim Il Sung put forward the people of the DPRK as the independent people. 
					
					 The bilateral cooperation would grow stronger thanks to Marshal Kim Jong Un, the supreme leader of the DPRK, the deputy envoy added. 
					
					 The deputy prime minister in charge of the Royal Palace of Cambodia said that the feats of Generalissimo Kim Il Sung in strengthening and developing the DPRK will always be remembered by the Korean people. He hoped for the further prosperity of the DPRK under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The chairman of the Nigeria-Korea Friendship Association noted that the foundation of the DPRK was a historical event which greatly encouraged the African people all out in the struggle to liberate their countries from the colonial rules.
					
					 He wished Kim Jong Un greater success in his noble work of leading the people of the DPRK in their efforts to build a thriving nation.

articles.title: Libyan Protestors Attack U.S. Consulate
articles.content:
Libyan Protestors Attack U.S. Consulate
						
 Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Hundreds of protesters angered by the U.S. movie that insulted the Prophet Mohammed broke into the U.S. consulate in the Libyan City of Benghazi on Sept. 11.
					 They staged a strong protest, setting fire to its building.
					
					 Reporting about this incident, the Al-Jazeera Satellite TV of Qatar said on Wednesday that the U.S. ambassador to Libya and three staff members of the consulate were killed in the attack.

articles.title: RPDC urge el desarme nuclear igualitario y proporcionado
articles.content:
RPDC urge el desarme nuclear igualitario y proporcionado 
						
Pyongyang, 13 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Al intervenir en la conferencia internacional sobre el desarme nuclear y la no proliferacion, efectuada el dia 7 en Moscu, el jefe de la delegacion del Instituto de Desarme y Paz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea se refirio a los remedios para asegurar la vitalidad del Tratado Comprensivo de Prohibicion de Prueba (Comprehensive Test Ban Treaty - CTBT en ingles). 
					Solo cuando el CTBT sea cumplido a condicion de que las armas nucleares fueran canceladas completamente en escala mundial, todos los paises podran asumir las obligaciones y derechos practicamente iguales y justos, dijo el y continuo: 
					
					En ese sentido, el asunto mas apremiante que el cumplimiento del CTBT es establecer en el ambito mundial el marco legal internacional sobre la prohibicion incondicional de uso y eliminacion completa de armas nucleares existentes en el mundo y buscar medidas imparciales y proporcionadas para el desarme y la cancelacion basados en la confianza mutua. 
					
					Para hacer efectivo en la realidad el CTBT, deberian preparar sus premisas y para eso, las potencias nucleares deberan cumplir con su responsabilidad y deber en los esfuerzos por eliminar la fuente de guerra nuclear en el mundo. 
					
					Especialmente, es importante para Estados Unidos, la superpotencia nuclear del mundo, parar todos los actos de aumento armamentista que destruyen la estabilidad mundial, tales como la modernizacion y la convencionalizacion de armas nucleares y el desarrollo de nuevas armas ultramodernas que puedan sustituir a aquellas. 
					
					Si EE.UU. no pone punto final a tales maniobras, no terminara en este planeta la nueva carrera armamentista entre las potencias para defender la seguridad y los intereses estrategicos propios y esto producira graves consecuencias para la paz y la estabilidad del mundo. 
					
					Como ha sido aclarado reiteradamente, la RPDC cumplira en el futuro su responsabilidad y deber para la no proliferacion como pais responsable con armas nucleares.

articles.title: ACRC denuncia su homologo surcoreano
articles.content:
ACRC denuncia su homologo surcoreano 
Pyongyang, 13 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Con respecto a que los titeres surcoreanos insultaron a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea en el tema de ayuda por los danos por inundaciones, el portavoz de la Asociacion de la Cruz Roja de la RPDC dio el dia 12 la siguiente respuesta a la ACNC: 
					El pasado dia 3, la Sociedad de la Cruz Roja del Sur de Corea envio un aviso que propone sostener el contacto de la cruz roja Norte-Sur exponiendo su voluntad de "brindar la ayuda sincera e incondicional" a la parte Norte (RPDC) por las perdidas causadas por inundaciones. 
					
					La parte Norte demando a anunciar las variedades y cantidad de los materiales de socorro, teniendo en consideracion la voluntad de la entidad surcoreana de enviarnos a base del espiritu humanitario los materiales a ser contribuidos realmente a la reestabilizacion de la vida de los habitantes de la zona damnificada y a la recuperacion de los danos pese a la situacion tan tensa creada por las imprudentes maniobras de provocacion de guerra de la banda traidora. 
					
					Y enfatizo claramente que sera inutil tal ayuda si las autoridades surcoreanas pretenden burlar a la parte Norte como lo hicieron en el pasado. 
					
					Sin embargo, a traves de su aviso fechado 11, la Sociedad de la Cruz Roja del Sur de Corea volvio a insultar gravemente a la parte Norte con algunos materiales triviales. 
					
					Los titeres surcoreanos no tuvieron desde el principio la voluntad de ayudar con sinceridad a la parte Norte que sufrio por las inundaciones.
					
					Y criticaron hasta la ayuda sincera de varios paises y organizaciones internacionales diciendo que "el Norte exagera las perdidas" e impidieron a las entidades civiles surcoreanas enviar los materiales de socorro so pretexto de "confirmar la distribucion y averiguar en el mismo terreno". 
					
					Ademas, disparatearon abiertamente que no se debe ofrecer el arroz, el cemento y los equipos de recuperacion que "podrian ser usados a otro objetivo".
					
					El hecho muestra que la propuesta de ayuda de los titeres surcoreanos no pasa de ser un acto enganoso por no poder resistir la opinion publica y para mantener el honor de si mismos. 
					
					Hasta la fecha se ha realizado en varias ocasiones la cooperacion humanitaria entre ambas partes coreanas. Pero, nadie actuo tan groseramente como la banda de Lee Myung Bak insultando el noble espiritu humanitario de la cruz roja. 
					
					Es muy ridiculo el que la Sociedad de la Cruz Roja del Sur de Corea abuse de los desastres naturales de la parte connacional actuando como titere de la banda traidora. 
					
					Se han revelado una vez mas las entranas malignas y sucias de la banda de traidores surcoreanos. 
					
					En cuanto a los danos por las inundaciones, no hemos depositado desde el principio ninguna esperanza en las autoridades surcoreanas titeres y se ha aumentado esta vez la decepcion sobre ellas. 
					
					La banda del traidor Lee Myung Bak, que enloquecida por la confrontacion fratricida, ya perdio hasta la etica y moralidad elementales y el juicio del hombre, no podra evadir el arruinamiento mas tragico por la condena de toda la nacion.

articles.title: Celebrada efemeride coreana en representaciones  de RPDC
articles.content:
Celebrada efemeride coreana en representaciones  de RPDC 
						
Pyongyang, 13 de septiembre (ACNC) -- En ocasion del 64o aniversario de la fundacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea tuvieron lugar del dia 3 al 7 recepciones, encuentros de recordacion, exhibiciones de libros y fotos y proyecciones filmicas en las representaciones de la RPDC en Beijing, Shenyang, Hong Kong, de China, Jabarovsk de Rusia, Vietnam, Mongolia, Laos, Camboya, Indonesia, Myanmar, Bangladesh, Egipto, Nigeria, Francia e Italia, la representacion permanente de la RPDC ante la ONU y las otras permanentes en la Oficina de la ONU en Ginebra y otras organizaciones internacionales.
					En los encuentros de cine se llevaron a la pantalla las peliculas coreanas.
					
					Fueron invitados a los actos las personalidades de gobiernos, partidos politicos, parlamentos, entidades, instituciones, organizaciones de estudio de la idea Juche y entidades de amistad y solidaridad con el pueblo coreano, las de organizaciones internacionales, regionales y no gubernamentales y los diplomaticos en los respectivos paises. 
					
					El vicepresidente de la Conferencia Consultiva Politica de la provincia de Liaoning de China senalo que desde el dia de su fundacion hasta hoy la RPDC ha logrado notables exitos en la construccion socialista bajo la sabia orientacion del Presidente Kim Il Sung, el General Kim Jong Il y el Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					
					El subrepresentante plenipotenciario del presidente en la zona federal del Lejano Oriente de Rusia puntualizo que el Presidente presento al pueblo coreano como el independiente, y agrego que se activara mas la cooperacion de los dos paises gracias al Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Maximo Dirigente de la RPDC.
					
					El vicepremier encargado del Palacio Real de Camboya dijo que quedaran grabadas eternamente en el corazon del pueblo coreano las hazanas de Su Excelencia Generalisimo Kim Il Sung acumuladas en el desarrollo de la RPDC y deseo que esta se prospere mas bajo la guia de Su Excelencia Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					
					El titular de la Asociacion de Amistad Nigeria-Corea destaco que la fundacion de la RPDC fue un acontecimiento historico que estimulo mucho a los pueblos de los paises africanos levantados en la lucha de liberacion nacional de colonias. 
					
					Deseo que el Mariscal logre mayores exitos en su trabajo para conducir la lucha del pueblo coreano por construir el Estado prospero.

articles.title: Diversas localidades dan ayuda a restauracion de zona de Komdok
articles.content:
Diversas localidades dan ayuda a restauracion de zona de Komdok
						
Pyongyang, 13 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Diversas localidades de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea brindan ayuda activa a la recuperacion de la zona de Komdok danada por inundaciones.
					El Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema, el Secretariado del Consejo de Ministros, el Ministerio de Industria Carbonifera, el Ministerio de Industria Extractiva, el Ministerio de Transporte Terrestre y Maritimo y los demas ministerios e instituciones centrales enviaron los materiales imprescindibles a la vida de los habitantes como los alimentos, articulos de uso domestico, vestidos, etc.
					
					Los funcionarios y otros trabajadores de la provincia de Hamgyong del Sur enviaron a la zona perjudicada el aceite comestible, alimentos subsidiarios y articulos de uso diario.
					
					Tambien los funcionarios y trabajadores de la ciudad de Pyongyang, las provincias de Hamgyong del Norte, de Kangwon, de Jagang y la ciudad de Rason despacharon alli los articulos de higiene, pijamas, cuadernos, etc.
					
					Los militares del Ejercito Popular de Corea y sus familiares y los empleados concernientes, que han sido movilizados para la recuperacion, les entregaron los articulos de cocina y alimentos basicos correspondientes a 400 familias.
					
					Por otra parte, el Complejo de Cemento de Sunchon, el Complejo de Acero Chollima, la Fabrica de Alambres Electricos 326 de Pyongyang y otras fabricas y empresas se esfuerzan por suministrar ante todo los materiales necesarios a la obra de reconstruccion.
